intro: Antirrhinum graniticum subsp. ambiguum, commonly known as the granitic snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to regions with rocky or arid soils. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as rocky outcrops and dry meadows. It produces small, elongated seed pods that release seeds when mature. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in its native range.
